In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

You can use the built-in `lowercase` function in Julia to convert a string to lowercase. Then you can use regular expressions (`rstrip`, `lstrip`) or the `replace` function to remove any leading or trailing whitespaces and replace spaces with underscores, as shown below:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(col), r"[ -]+", "_")
end
```

This `clean_column` function first converts the input string to lower case using the `lowercase` function, and then it uses regular expressions to remove any leading or trailing spaces (represented by `r"[ -]+"`). The result is a string where all spaces are replaced with underscores.
